snippet: Valley fever has been labeled “a silent epidemic,” with more than 20,000 cases reported each year, but each case is different, and doctors have yet to find a cure.
abstract: Valley fever, which Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has labeled 'a silent epidemic,' is striking more people each year, with more than 20,000 reported cases annually throughout the Southwest; especially prevalent in California and Arizona, each case is different, and doctors have yet to find a cure.
lead_paragraph: Valley fever has been labeled “a silent epidemic,” with more than 20,000 cases reported each year, but each case is different, and doctors have yet to find a cure.

headline.main: A Disease Without a Cure Spreads Quietly in the West
headline.print_headline: A Disease Without a Cure Spreads Quietly in the West
